title: Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Night Table", March 18, 1937
medium: Graphite, black ink on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right:  8570/F.S./ANDERSON, OLSSON/DILLM./D./3/18/37, 3/22/37, 1, MASTERCR.; inscribed in graphite above stamp: NOTE!/ALL EXPOSED EDGES TO BE/VENEERED, ALSO DOOR EDGES/ONE NIGHT TABLE 18" x 15" 20 1/2" HIGH/EAST INDIAN ROSEWOOD ALSO THE OPENINGS/ONE EXTENSION SLIDE ON FRONT SIDE E.I. ROSEWOOD/TO HOUSE SWITCH BOX x BELL BOX/ONE ELECTRIC CLOCK ATTACHED/TO DOOR, UPPER PART OF BACK/REMAINS OPEN FOR WIRING/PROVIDE EXTRA PANEL FOR SWITCH BOX OPENING/ON TOP. GRAIN TO MATCH REST OF TOP/DOMES OF SILENCE/VENEER ALL EXPOSED EDGES, ALSO EDGES/OF SMALL DOOR/DO NOT CUT HOLE FOR CLOCKBEFORE/RECEIVING SAME.
description: Plans and elevavtions for night table. Table at left of bed in East Indian Rosewood. On front side, on extension slide near top; large open space below with shelf near top. Side of table facing bed with electric clock attached at right near top and open space to left of clock. Switch box opening on top of table.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Night Table", March 18, 1937.
March 18, 1937. Graphite, black ink on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-1004.
